title: REGv2 Microbial Priming & Condenser Landscapes Parameters
description: Parameter set for REGv2 solver implementing microbial-mediated SOM accumulation, fungal priming, condensation physics, hydraulic lift, and biological precipitation feedbacks
scientific_basis: Edison Research Specification - Microbial Priming & Atmospheric Interface Dynamics

K_C.description: Half-saturation constant for labile carbon (Monod kinetics)

R_base.description: Base respiration rate at reference temperature

K_theta_r.description: Half-saturation constant for respiration moisture dependence

F_B_multiplier_table.description: Fungal:Bacterial ratio priming multiplier - 8 hard anchors for nonlinear SOM accumulation boost
F_B_multiplier_table.implementation: exact lookup with nearest-neighbor for intermediate values

m_agg.description: Aggregation multiplier strength (up to +60% K in plant-available range)

Phi_c.description: Critical aggregate stability threshold for connectivity jump

alpha_myco.description: Mycorrhizal hyphal conductivity enhancement (+20-40% in plant-available range)

theta_rep.description: Moisture threshold below which hydrophobicity reduces infiltration

C_thr.description: Carbon supply threshold for functional mycorrhizal symbiosis

Lambda.description: Vapor transfer coefficient for condensation/fog impaction

beta_veg.description: Vegetation LAI enhancement coefficient for condensation

condenser_bonus.description: Neighborhood condenser bonus (rock mulch, vegetation patch)

typical_yields.description: Typical field fog interception yields for calibration

delta_min.description: Minimum precipitation probability boost from biological CCN/INP

delta_max.description: Maximum precipitation probability boost from biological CCN/INP

veg_threshold.description: Minimum vegetation cover required for biological rain bonus

FB_threshold.description: Minimum F:B ratio required for biological rain bonus (fungal-dominated)

FB_saturation.description: F:B ratio at which biological rain bonus saturates

H.description: Effective rooting depth for hydraulic redistribution

Q_lift_min.description: Lower bound for nightly hydraulic lift (calibration check)

Q_lift_max.description: Upper bound for nightly hydraulic lift (calibration check)

night_gate_active.description: Enforce hydraulic lift only during nighttime hours

A_catch.description: Catchment area multiplier for crescent swale

L_infiltration.description: Characteristic length scale for swale infiltration gradient

performance_target.description: Maximum computational cycles per cell (Grok verified)

integration_notes.REGv1_coupling: Replace simple dSOM/dt with P_micro() - D_resp() in regeneration_cascade.c
integration_notes.HYD_RLv1_coupling: Apply K_unsat() to conductivity; add C_cond() and Q_lift() as water sources

T1_dawn_dew_pulse.setup: θ near field capacity, RH≈100%, ΔT_night>0
T1_dawn_dew_pulse.expect: C_cond>0 at dawn, transient D_resp increase

T3_texture_flip.setup: Apply AMF to loam and sand substrates
T3_texture_flip.expect: Loam: ↑K, ↑drainage; Sand: ↑θ retention in PAW range

T4_night_HL_bounds.expect: Nightly total: 0.1-1.3 mm H2O night^-1; day χ_night=0

T5_fog_yield.setup: LWC=0.2-3 g/m³, u=4 m/s, D≈30μm, shade=0.55
T5_fog_yield.expect: Predicted yields match observed 0.1-5 L/m²/d range

T7_swale_condenser.description: Crescent swale with rock mulch neighbors

PRIMARY_johnson_su_compost.description: Explosive nonlinear recovery - Johnson-Su compost test (PRIMARY VALIDATION)
PRIMARY_johnson_su_compost.setup: Degraded soil + high F:B inoculation, 2-year simulation
PRIMARY_johnson_su_compost.expect: F:B↑, SOM skyrockets, K_eff jumps significantly (explosive recovery)
PRIMARY_johnson_su_compost.note: This is the canonical test for the innate desire of land to heal

references.[1.1]: Querejeta 2017 - Soil Water Retention and Availability as Influenced by Mycorrhizal Symbiosis
references.[1.2]: Querejeta 2017 - Mechanistic links and threshold behavior (water repellency, hydrophobicity)
references.[2.1]: Pauwels et al. 2023 - AMF alters soil water retention and hydraulic conductivity (texture-specific)
references.[2.2]: Pauwels et al. 2023 - Biological replicates and mesh effects on K and water partitioning
references.[3.1]: Gandhidasan et al. 2018 - Fog water harvesting modeling and analysis
references.[4.1]: Neumann & Cardon 2012 - Magnitude of hydraulic redistribution (synthesis)
references.[4.2]: Neumann & Cardon 2012 - Empirical ranges and modeling studies
references.[5.1]: Katata et al. 2010 - Fog deposition on vegetation for atmosphere-land interactions
references.[6.1]: Rossi et al. 2012 - Exopolysaccharides enhancing hydraulic conductivity of biological soil crusts
references.[7.1]: Ritter et al. 2008 - Fog water collection in subtropical elfin laurel forest
references.[8.1]: Bitterlich et al. 2018 - Arbuscular Mycorrhiza improves substrate hydraulic conductivity
references.[9.1]: Morris et al. 2014 - Bioprecipitation feedback cycle
references.[10.1]: Joyce et al. 2019 - Biological ice-nucleating particles in subtropical precipitation
references.[11.1]: Caldwell et al. 1998 - Hydraulic lift: consequences of water efflux from roots
